channel.title: Pay for top ad and get scammed?
channel.description:
Simplexus paid $475.00 for top ad this month for it to be hacked? All of the links on our ad were changed to "perfectionx". I don't know how long this has been going on for but I am appalled that we've payed this amount of money for our traffic to be detoured to another site. How did I get hacked? My moparscape password is unique, and yet, it was still the same for me to log in with after our ad got sabotaged. Something needs to be done about this..
http://i.gyazo.com/60408620524f6db26d18d71ae8139288.png

item.title: Pay for top ad and get scammed?
item.dc:creator: @Simplexus Simplexus
item.description:
@Simplexus wrote:

I like how this guy has made up this entire convoluted scheme to make it seem like he is the victim. Yes, I am definitely taking time to advertise on his server while I’m working 12 hours a day and not even on my own server twice a week.

Here is the correct order of events, I would like it to be known how much of a low life piece of shit this “Yoddle” insect is.

Nov 2014

Yoddle uses PI exploit to get my password, attacks my servers economy by spawning infinite piles of rares and then jacks our very first top ad at Mopar. (see first post)

Nov 2014

Simplexus contacts Mopar (Via this thread and PMs) in order to try and get a handle on this scumbag.

Mar 2015

Yoddle (the scummiest skid you’ll meet) finds another exploit and uses it to dupe on my server – this in retaliation to a player from Simplexus (>>allegedly<<) advertising in HIS KINGDOM (PRAISE KING ALPHONSE [AKA Yoddle] https://gyazo.com/56ecce511dd9b4384dc3b27d0107dc86)

May 2015

Yoddle finds yet another exploit, but this time within my webserver and uses it to inject a rat in place of the launcher my players use to play. He then attacks many of my players and manages to attack me as well, bringing my forums down, hosting accounts down and, my personal favorite, even went to the length of hacking my personal RuneScape account. via my e-mail.

May 2015

Yoddle steals all of Simplexus’ player files and demands a RuneScape GP ransom in return for the files and for a lock he placed on the VPS removed. Yes, an RS GP RANSOM. My head exploded when I read this off of my “locked” VPS, along with a link to see Skype.

May 2015

Simplexus’ retaliation to this atrocity of a human being. A Skype message.

From Skype: (Me -> Yoddle)

Thank you for launching the final attack that will bring my server down. I will be sure to cover all my bases as far as security goes in the future.

I don’t know how this makes you feel as a person, but I personally would feel like an absolute bag of shit for not only ruining a server severely less successful than my own, but further hacking into a person’s email, stealing information and accounts that are of little to no gain to yourself and further demanding some sort of ransom to free the small amount of data that was keeping this tiny community afloat… Thank you for showing me how low of scum this world can coagulate in it’s deepest, repugnant depths.

Have a delightful life, provided that’s a possibility given your degree of malice toward life.

It’s been nice having your site as a primary ad Steven. I will not be the last one to cease using MoparScape because of Yoddle, use the thousands of dollars we’ve put forward as incentive if you have to. Farewell sir.

Read full topic
item.source: Pay for top ad and get scammed?

item.title: Pay for top ad and get scammed?
item.dc:creator: @yoddle yoddle
item.description:
@yoddle wrote:

So wait… You go on multiple servers advertising your server and expect your computer to be safe? you expect no retaliation for what you keep doing?
I added you on skype and told you not to advertise on my server then you go off saying “fuck off” and block me? well this is the outcome, you keep dragging on this fight by “paying” hack forum users to deface my website then when we hit back you come back here crying.

Pfft, dude, move on.

As for Moparisthebest,

I’m honestly sorry the fight has interrupted your business,
I can guarantee it won’t ever happen again to any of your sponsors.

I’m a loyal Moparscape Sponsor and always will be, expect more this entire summer.

Kind Regards,

Dan Welle.

Read full topic
item.source: Pay for top ad and get scammed?

item.title: Pay for top ad and get scammed?
item.dc:creator: @Simplexus Simplexus
item.description:
@Simplexus wrote:

https://www.moparisthebest.com/serverstatus.php?server=newperfection.no-ip.info

Yeah he got around your quick fix by dubbing the links with a redirect.

You could always just revoke his shit for being malicious. That’s what I’d do.

Read full topic
item.source: Pay for top ad and get scammed?

item.title: Pay for top ad and get scammed?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Someone elses sponsored spot was just edited to link to the same server, so whoever runs/advertises PerfectionX is definitly a problem, so I went ahead an censored ‘perfectionx’ to ‘google’ so if they ever change anyones links again, they’ll just go to google instead, once they figure that out it should stop completely.

I also checked the rest of the servers to be sure they weren’t changed, and they were all good.

If you have a popular server or a sponsored spot, you need to keep your password, security questions/answers, and your email password and security questions/answers safe, or this could happen to you too.

Read full topic
item.source: Pay for top ad and get scammed?

item.title: Pay for top ad and get scammed?
item.dc:creator: @Simplexus Simplexus
item.description:
@Simplexus wrote:

That would be good, especially if it’s an alternate IP applying changes. Maybe having to answer a secret question before performing edits on a new IP [one time].

Read full topic
item.source: Pay for top ad and get scammed?

item.title: Pay for top ad and get scammed?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

IRC was misconfigured on the IRC end, anyone who visited that page was told they were banned, it should be fixed now.

I don’t have any hard evidence either way, I guess I need to add more logging, but I suspect this guy is the one that did it:

https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=profile;u=686121

I’m also trying to think of ways to prevent this from happening in the future, what about an option (checkbox I guess) that would send you an email alert if your server was edited at all (or, of course, if the box was unchecked)? Got any other ideas?

Read full topic
item.source: Pay for top ad and get scammed?

item.title: Pay for top ad and get scammed?
item.dc:creator: @Simplexus Simplexus
item.description:
@Simplexus wrote:

I change my password regularly for e-mail (most recently 4 days ago) and I only use combinations of letters & numbers, nothing comprehensible / guessable.

As for your site, I’ve used the same password since I joined and have had little-no worries about changing it as I’ve never heard of any problems like this.

I may have been key-logged, I’ve got no idea how and the only thing that is amiss is my MoparScape account which was why I placed the blame on your system. I’ll be formatting all of my HDs to be sure…

Thank you for investigating this further & quickly responding.

Edit:

I’ve tried to get on IRC but apparently I am banned. http://gyazo.com/0db983c659d009f61cdbfa6079a73e5a

Read full topic
item.source: Pay for top ad and get scammed?

item.title: Pay for top ad and get scammed?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Simplexus, post:3, topic:547637”]Well, explain to me how I’ve changed my password and yet “perfectionx” was STILL able to change the main link to my site?

This is completely ridiculous man. We pay for your ads every month and all you can offer me are your condolences.
This is the last time we pay > $150 for an ad here.[/quote]

You mean they changed it, you logged in with your old password, changed it to a new password, changed it back and then they changed it again? If so, do you think you might have a keylogger or something like that?

I’m searching through logs to see if I can find IPs of anyone editing your server.

edit: If you have time to chat right now you can join the IRC, either with your client or the ‘CHAT’ link up top.

edit2:
I’ve done some more digging to make sure someone couldn’t edit your server without actually logging in with your password, and since the whole system is open source, I can show you that they must have been logged in:

register2() is the function called when editing or registering a server:
https://github.com/moparisthebest/Server-Status-Page/blob/master/ss_sources/register.php#L23
it calls the forceLogin() method, which can be found here:
https://github.com/moparisthebest/Server-Status-Page/blob/master/ss_sources/util.php#L77
If you are not logged in, it shows the login form and exits, which stops the server from being edited/registered.
Back to register2(), if all the other checks pass, even the SQL query itself is limited to only be able to change the server belonging to the user currently logged in via UID:
https://github.com/moparisthebest/Server-Status-Page/blob/master/ss_sources/register.php#L87

So, long story short, the only way anyone can edit a server is if they are logged in as the user who owns the server, so I’m fairly confident someone has your details.

If they don’t know the password itself (though it seems like they do), they can reset the password if they have access to your email or know your secret question, do you know those are secure as well?

Read full topic
item.source: Pay for top ad and get scammed?

item.title: Pay for top ad and get scammed?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I don’t know what to tell you, I guess someone got your password and logged into your account and changed it, it couldn’t have happened any other way. Not even mods/admins have access to change server status page entries.

Read full topic
